SEARCH
Package game.levels

Class LevelFrame

java.lang.Object
game.levels.LevelFrame
Direct Known Subclasses:
GothicCemetery, HauntedForest, MagicCliff
public abstract class LevelFrame extends Object
An abstract class that serves as a base for all levels in the game. It manages the level number, boundaries, and ground frames.

    • initLevel

      protected abstract void initLevel(int levelNumber)
      Initialises Environment level.
      This method is called in the constructor of the level.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - the level number
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the level number is invalid.

    • objectiveComplete

      protected abstract void objectiveComplete()
      Called when the objective is complete.
      This method is called in checkForMobsDead().

    • setBoundaries

      protected void setBoundaries(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 centre, float upperY, float lowerY, float leftX, float rightX)
      Sets the values of boundaries and returns the centre of the level.
      Parameters:
      centre - the centre of the level (Vec2)
      upperY - the upper Y boundary
      lowerY - the lower Y boundary
      leftX - the left X boundary
      rightX - the right X boundary

    • add

      public GroundFrame add(String name, GroundFrame groundFrame)
      Adds a ground frame to the level.
      If a ground frame with the same name already exists, it will not be added.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the ground frame
      groundFrame - the ground frame to add
      Returns:
      the ground frame object

    • getPos

      protected org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getPos(String name)
      Returns the origin position in relation centre of the added GroundFrame with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the ground frame
      Returns:
      a Vec2 object representing the position of the GroundFrame

      Checks if the given walker is out of bounds.

      Returns:
      true if the walker is out of bounds, false otherwise

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the level.

      Adds the level stepListener to the world.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the level.

      Removes the level stepListener from the world.

    • checkForMobsDead

      public void checkForMobsDead()
      Checks if all mobs are dead.
      If all mobs are dead, the game is over.
